p: Pyrrosia lingua ( P. lingua) belongs to the Polypodiaceae family and mostly occurs in China, Japan, Korea and other Asian regions [ 52]. P. lingua is known for its antiviral, antioxidant, antibacterial and anticancer activities; it even stops the formation of urinary calculi [ 52, 53]. Furthermore, it contains several bioactive components, such as flavonoids, chlorogenic acid, mangiferin, isomangiferin, astragalin and trifolin [ 54]. The extract of P. lingua leaves has been used by many researchers for the treatment of HIV, SARS and other viral infections [ 50, 52, 53]. In the case of SARS-CoV-1, this plant has shown the ability to inhibit viral infection, but the mechanism of action is still not clear [ 48, 50].
